definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: From that day after, brocade the lotus then don't dare to easily privately get in touch with with route son again.
sentences.chinese: 从那日之后，锦莲便不敢再轻易和小路子私下接触。

sentences.english: I had a private audience with the King, and made a proposition.
sentences.chinese: 我私下朝见国王，向他陈言献策。

sentences.english: A: Is there a chance you could contact the client confidentially and see what they think?
sentences.chinese: 你有机会私下接触客户看他们会怎么想吗？

sentences.english: Could we have a word before you go to the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你去开会之前，咱们能私下说句话吗？

sentences.english: Cheshire himself has said the business is in a "horrible" state.
sentences.chinese: 柴什曾私下表示在华业务正处于“可怕”的状态。

sentences.english: He says he loathes her, but I think in secret he really likes her.
sentences.chinese: 他说他讨厌她，但我私下认为他真的喜欢她。

sentences.english: I rated him from the off.
sentences.chinese: 这是我对他私下的评价”。

sentences.english: Admonish your friend privately , but praise them openly.
sentences.chinese: 要私下告诫朋友，但要公开夸奖朋友。

sentences.english: A couple can privately prove their commitment to one another by cohabiting.
sentences.chinese: 一对伴侣可以通过同居来私下表明他们对彼此的承诺。

sentences.english: But, he said the inquiry itself would be conducted in private.
sentences.chinese: 但是布朗说，调查本身将在私下进行。

sentences.english: There is private fury with Legg in Downing Street for rewriting the rules.
sentences.chinese: 但在唐宁街，仍然有人私下对莱格修改规定愤恨不已。

sentences.english: Yet he has also conceded, privately, that it would be a huge wrench to leave Stamford Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 但是特里私下承认斯坦福桥让他难以割舍。

sentences.english: We told him that he failed in private so he could save face.
sentences.chinese: 我们私下里告诉他，他失败了，这样可以留点面子。

sentences.english: Senators and congressmen play footsie (with each other) while the situation gets steadily worse.
sentences.chinese: 参议员和国会议员私下勾搭，形势越来越坏。

sentences.english: Admonish your friends privately, praise them openly.
sentences.chinese: 私下告诫朋友，公开赞扬朋友。
第二层就是私下刻板印象。

definition: not to get along well/to be on bad terms/to be at odds/discord
to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
